page.name: Course Resources
page.content:
These resources provide in-depth knowledge of the concepts and practices taught in this course. Use the resources to apply the concepts and expand your knowledge of integrating the practices into your adult education classroom.

American Institutes for Research. (2016). English Language Proficiency Standards for Adult Education. Washington DC. Retrieved from https://lincs.ed.gov/publications/pdf/elp-standards-adult-ed.pdf

American Institutes for Research. (2015). Integrating Employability Skills: A Framework for All Educators. Washington DC. Retrieved from http://www.ccrscenter.org/implementation-tools/integrating-employability-skills

The Conference Board, Inc., the Partnership for 21st Century Skills, Corporate Voices for Working Families, and the Society for Human Resource Management. (2006). Are They Really Ready to Work? Employers’ Perspectives on the Basic Knowledge and Applied Skills of New Entrants to the 21st Century U.S. Workforce. Retrieved from http://www.p21.org/storage/documents/FINAL_REPORT_PDF09-29-06.pdf

ATLAS-Academic Career & Employability Skills. (2013). Transitions Integration Framework. Saint Paul. Retrieved from www.atlasabe.org/professional/transitions

Carnevale, A. (2008). The Workplace Realities. Georgetown Center on Education and the Workforce. The School Administrator.

Center for Occupational Research and Development (CORD). Retrieved from http://www.cord.org/

Hart Research Associates. (2015). Falling Short? College Learning and Career Success.

La Guardia Community College. College and Career Pathways Institute. Retrieved from http://www.laguardia.edu/ACE/Programs/CCPI/Home/

Lesgold, A. and Welch-Ross, M. eds. (2012) Improving Adult Literacy Instruction: Options for Practice and Research, Washington, DC: The National Academies Press.

LINCS ESLPro. (2016). Preparing English Language Learners for Work and Career Pathways Issue Brief. Retrieved from https://lincs.ed.gov/publications/pdf/ELL_Context_Instruction_508.pdf

Manufacturing Institute. (2011). Boiling Point? The Skills Gap in Manufacturing.

National Center for Educational Statistics (NCES). (October, 2013). Literacy, Numeracy, and Problem Solving in Technology Rich Environments Among U.S. Adults: Results from the Program for the International Assessment of Adult Competencies 2012. Retrieved from https://nces.ed.gov/pubs2014/2014008.pdf

National Network of Business and Industry Associations. (July, 2014). Common Employability Skills: A Foundation for Success in the Workplace: The Skills All Employees Need, No Matter Where They Work. Retrieved from http://actfdn.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/National-Network_EmployabilitySkills_July2014.pdf

Partnership for 21st Century Learning (P21). Framework for 21st Century Learning. Retrieved from http://www.p21.org/storage/documents/P21_framework_0515.pdf

Partnership for 21st Century Learning (P21). P21 Framework Definitions. (2015). Retrieved from http://www.p21.org/storage/documents/docs/P21_Framework_Definitions_New_Logo_2015.pdf

Pellegrino, James W. and Hilton, Margaret L., eds. Education for Life and Work: Developing Transferable Knowledge and Skills in the 21st Century, Washington, DC: The National Academies Press, 2012.

Pellegrino, James W. and Hilton, Margaret L., et. al. Education for Life and Work: Guide for Practitioners. Washington, DC: National Research Council, 2012.

Perin, Dolores. (2011). Facilitating Student Learning Through Contextualization. Community College Research Center Working Paper 29. Teachers College, Columbia University: New York. Retrieved from http://ccrc.tc.columbia.edu/media/k2/attachments/facilitating-learning-contextualization-working-paper.pdf

Pimentel, Susan. (2013). College and Career Readiness Standards for Adult Education. Retrieved from https://lincs.ed.gov/professional-development/resource-collections/profile-521

Shechtman, N., Yarnall, L., Sites, R., & Cheng, B. (2016). Empowering Adults to Thrive at Work: Personal Success Skills for 21st Century Jobs. Joyce Foundation. Retrieved from https://www.sri.com/sites/default/files/publications/joyceempoweringadultstothriveatwork_4.pdf

Tech Tips for Teachers. http://techtipsforteachers.weebly.com/

U.S. Department of Education, Employability Skills Framework, http://cte.ed.gov/employabilityskills/

U.S. Department of Education, Office of Career, Technical, and Adult Education. (2015, February). Making Skills Everyone’s Business: A Call to Transform Adult Learning in the United States. Washington, D.C.: Author.

U.S. Department of Education, Office of Career, Technical, and Adult Education. (2015). Integrating Technology in WIOA Fact Sheet. Retrieved from https://www2.ed.gov/about/offices/list/ovae/pi/AdultEd/integrating-technology.pdf

U.S. Department of Education, Office of Career, Technical, and Adult Education. (2015). Program Memorandum OCTAE/DAEL 15-4, U.S. Department of Education.

U.S. Department of Education, Office of Career, Technical, and Adult Education. (2016). Programs and Activities Authorized by the Adult Education and Family Literacy Act (Title II of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act). Retrieved from https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2016/08/19/2016-16049/programs-and-activities-authorized-by-the-adult-education-and-family-literacy-act-title-ii-of-the

Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act. (2014).[JS1]  Retrieved from https://www.gpo.gov/fdsys/pkg/PLAW-113publ128/pdf/PLAW-113publ128.pdf

World Education, Inc. (2014). Guide to ELA Classroom Activities that Promote Life Skills, College, and Career Readiness. Retrieved from https://lincs.ed.gov/professional-development/resource-collections/profile-864  

Continue to the Glossary to review key concepts in this course or exit the course when finished
